sen.j: 田手畷の戦い （たてなわてのたたかい）は、享禄3年（1530年）、北九州の覇権をめぐり周防国の戦国大名大内氏と肥前国の戦国大名少弐氏との間で起きた戦い。
sen.e: The Battle of Tatenawate was a war that took place in 1530 over hegemony of Kitakyushu between two daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku Period: the Ouchi clan of Suo Province and Shoni clan of Hizen Province.

The Battle of Tatenawate was a war that took place in 1530 over hegemony of Kitakyushu between two daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku Period: the Ouchi clan of Suo Province and Shoni clan of Hizen Province.

The Battle of Tatenawate was a war that took place in 1530 over hegemony of Kitakyushu between two daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States): the Ouchi clan of Suo Province and Shoni clan of Hizen Province.

sen.j: 大内氏と少弐氏とは、室町時代を通じて北九州（大宰府）の覇権を争う宿敵同士であった。
sen.e: The Ouchi clan and Shoni clan were old enemies with each other who fought over hegemony of Kitakyushu (Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region)) although the Muromachi Period.
The Ouchi clan and Shoni clan were old enemies with each other who fought over hegemony of Kitakyushu (Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region)) all through the Muromachi Period.
The Ouchi clan and Shoni clan were old enemies with each other who fought over hegemony of Kitakyushu (Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region)) all through the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 明応6年（1497年）には大内義興は少弐政資を滅ぼし、かつては鎮西の覇者であった少弐氏を肥前の一地方勢力に転落させることに成功している。
sen.e: Yoshioki OUCHI defeated Masasuke SHONI in 1497 and succeeded in making Shoni clan, once the hegemon of Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu) demoted to a regional power.
Yoshioki OUCHI defeated Masasuke SHONI in 1497 and succeeded in making the Shoni clan, once the hegemony of Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu) demoted to a regional power.
Yoshioki OUCHI defeated Masasuke SHONI in 1497 and succeeded in making the Shoni clan, once the hegemony of Chinzei (nickname of Kyushu) demoted to a regional power.

sen.j: 大内義隆（義興の子）は宿敵の少弐資元（政資の子）に止めを刺すべく筑前国守護代杉興連に命じて大内方の北九州の諸将を率いさせ、資元の居城肥前国勢福寺城を攻撃させた。
sen.e: Yoshitaka OUCHI (a son of Yoshioki) ordered Okitsura SUGI, Shugodai (deputy of Shugo, provincial constable) of Chikuzen Province, to lead the warlords of Kitakyushu in the Ouchi side to attack Seifukuji-jo Castle in Hizen Province, the castle of Sukemoto SHONI (a son of Sukemoto SHONI) in Hizen Province,

Yoshitaka OUCHI (a son of Yoshioki) ordered Okitsura SUGI, Shugodai (deputy of Shugo, provincial constable) of Chikuzen Province, to lead the warlords of Kitakyushu in the Ouchi side to attack Seifukuji-jo Castle in Hizen Province, the castle of Sukemoto SHONI (a son of Sukemoto SHONI) in Hizen Province.

Yoshitaka OUCHI (a son of Yoshioki) ordered Okitsura SUGI, Shugodai (deputy of Shugo, provincial constable) of Chikuzen Province, to lead the warlords of Kitakyushu in the Ouchi side to attack Seifukuji-jo Castle in Hizen Province, the castle of Sukemoto SHONI (a son of Sukemoto SHONI) in Hizen Province.

sen.j: しかし、少弐方の諸将（龍造寺家兼や馬場頼周など）が奮戦し、鍋島清久率いる赤熊軍団の活躍もあって、遠征してきた興連を敗走させた。
sen.e: However the warlords of the Shoni clan side (such as Iekane RYUZOJI and Yorichika BABA) fought bravely and Red bear force led by Kiyohisa NABESHIMA played an important role in making invading Okitsura run away.

However the warlords of the Shoni clan side (such as Iekane RYUZOJI and Yorichika BABA) fought bravely and Red bear force led by Kiyohisa NABESHIMA played an important role in making invading Okitsura run away.

However the warlords of the Shoni clan side (such as Iekane RYUZOJI and Yorichika BABA) fought bravely and Red bear force led by Kiyohisa NABESHIMA played an important role in making invading Okitsura run away.

sen.j: 大内方は横岳資貞・筑紫尚門などが戦死している。
sen.e: Sukesada YOKODAKE and Naokado TSUKUSHI of the Ouchi side were killed in battle.
Sukesada YOKODAKE and Naokado TSUKUSHI of the Ouchi side were killed in battle.
Sukesada YOKODAKE and Naokado TSUKUSHI of the Ouchi side were killed in battle.

sen.j: この勝利に勢いづいた少弐氏は逆に大宰府に侵攻するなど一時勢力を回復させた。
sen.e: The Shoni clan increased its momentum after this victory and recovered its strength by invading Dazaifu..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Shoni clan increased its momentum after this victory and recovered its strength by invading Dazaifu.
The Shoni clan increased its momentum after this victory and recovered its strength by invading Dazaifu.

sen.j: しかし大内家の周防国守護代陶興房が九州に乗り込んでくると再び劣勢になり、さらには義隆が自身で大軍を率いて攻勢をかけて来ると、頼みの家兼にも見放された。
sen.e: However it lost strength again when Okifusa SUE, the Ouchi clan's Shugodai of Suo Province joined the war in Kyushu, and furthermore it was given up by reliable Iekane when Yoshitaka himself launched offensive with large army..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However it lost strength again when Okifusa SUE, the Ouchi clan's Shugodai of Suo Province joined the war in Kyushu, and furthermore it was given up by reliable Iekane when Yoshitaka himself launched offensive with large a army.

However it lost strength again when Okifusa SUE, the Ouchi clan's Shugodai of Suo Province joined the war in Kyushu, and furthermore it was given up by reliable Iekane when Yoshitaka himself launched offensive with a large army.

sen.j: 天文 (元号)4年（1535年）には、資元は自刃して果てたため、少弐氏は一時滅亡した。
sen.e: After Sukemoto was killed himself in 1535, the clan temporarily collapsed.
After Sukemoto was killed himself in 1535, the clan temporarily collapsed.
After Sukemoto was killed himself in 1535, the clan temporarily collapsed.
